alert.note: Alert for Columbus; Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Robeson, western Columbus and northeastern Horry Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Boardman to Green Sea. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whiteville, Tabor City, Loris, Chadbourn, Bethel, Fair Bluff, Boardman, Hallsboro, Nakina, Redbug, Southeastern Community College, Williams, Goretown, Cherry Grove, Mollie, Sidney, Clarendon, Dulah, Evergreen, and Green Sea. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.
